item.title: pani Katarzyna add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: pani Katarzyna add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "I have a theory that every time you make an important choice, the part of you left behind continues the other life you could have had." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: pani Katarzyna add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "Love is the longing for the half of ourselves we have lost." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: pani Katarzyna add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "Do you wake up as I do, having forgotten what it is that hurts or where, until you move? There is a second of consciousness that is clean again. A second that is you, without memory or experience, the animal warm and waking into a brand new world. There is the sun dissolving the dark, and light as clear as music, filling the room where you sleep and the other rooms behind your eyes." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: pani Katarzyna add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "Capacity for love in its higher forms seems to be peculiarly human although even in humans it is still peculiar." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: pani Katarzyna add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I should not talk so much about myself if there were anybody else whom I knew as well." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: pani Katarzyna add a quote by Nikolai V. Gogol
item.description: "The longer and more carefully we look at a funny story, the sadder it becomes." -- Nikolai V. Gogol

item.title: pani Katarzyna add a quote by Tennessee Williams
item.description: "Yes, I have tricks in my pocket, I have things up my sleeve. But I am the opposite of a stage magician. He gives you illusion that has the appearance of truth. I give you truth in the pleasant disguise of illusion." -- Tennessee Williams

item.title: pani Katarzyna add a quote by Tennessee Williams
item.description: "We all live in a house on fire, no fire department to call; no way out, just the upstairs window to look out of while the fire burns the house down with us trapped, locked in it." -- Tennessee Williams

item.title: pani Katarzyna add a quote by William Carlos Williams
item.description: "It is at the edge of a petal that love waits." -- William Carlos Williams

item.title: pani Katarzyna add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: pani Katarzyna add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "Let others pride themselves about how many pages they have written; I'd rather boast about the ones I've read." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: pani Katarzyna add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "Better to sleep with a sober cannibal than a drunk Christian." -- Herman Melville

item.title: pani Katarzyna add a quote by Ezra Pound
item.description: "The sum of human wisdom is not contained in any one language, and no single language is capable of expressing all forms and degrees of human comprehension." -- Ezra Pound

item.title: pani Katarzyna add a quote by Lorna Dee Cervantes
item.description: "A man's whole life / may be a metaphor - but a woman's lot / is symbol." -- Lorna Dee Cervantes

item.title: pani Katarzyna add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "You live like this, sheltered, in a delicate world, and you believe you are living. Then you read a book… or you take a trip… and you discover that you are not living, that you are hibernating. The symptoms of hibernating are easily detectable: first, restlessness. The second symptom (when hibernating becomes dangerous and might degenerate into death): absence of pleasure. That is all. It appears like an innocuous illness. Monotony, boredom, death. Millions live like this (or die like this) without knowing it. They work in offices. They drive a car. They picnic with their families. They raise children. And then some shock treatment takes place, a person, a book, a song, and it awakens them and saves them from death. Some never awaken." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: pani Katarzyna add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "You're on Earth. There's no cure for that." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: pani Katarzyna add a quote by John Stewart Mill
item.description:
"I did not mean that Conservatives are generally stupid; I meant, that stupid persons are generally Conservative. I believe that to be so obvious and undeniable a fact that I hardly think any hon. Gentleman will question it.
[<i>John Stuart Mill, in a Parliamentary debate with the Conservative MP, John Pakington, May 31, 1866</i>.]" -- John Stewart Mill

item.title: pani Katarzyna add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "If you show someone something you've written, you give them a sharpened stake, lie down in your coffin, and say, ‘When you’re ready’." -- David Mitchell

item.title: pani Katarzyna add a quote by Joy Harjo
item.description:
"It's possible to understand the world from studying a leaf. You can comprehend the laws of aerodynamics, mathematics, poetry and biology through the complex beauty of such a perfect structure.
It's also possible to travel the whole globe and learn nothing." -- Joy Harjo

item.title: pani Katarzyna add a quote by Joy Harjo
item.description: "I release you, my beautiful and terrible fear. I release you. You were my beloved and hate twin, but now, I don't know you as myself" -- Joy Harjo

item.title: pani Katarzyna add a quote by Wislawa Szymborska
item.description: "Loveless work, boring work, work valued only because others haven't got even that much, however loveless and boring--this is one of the harshest human miseries." -- Wislawa Szymborska

item.title: pani Katarzyna add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "‎Life is a shipwreck, but we must not forget to sing in the lifeboats." -- Voltaire

item.title: pani Katarzyna add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "You must have chaos within you to give birth to a dancing star." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: pani Katarzyna add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "There are no facts, only interpretations." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: pani Katarzyna add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Most men lead lives of quiet desperation and go to the grave with the song still in them." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: pani Katarzyna add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "The greatest compliment that was ever paid me was when one asked me what I thought, and attended to my answer." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: pani Katarzyna add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Disobedience is the true foundation of liberty. The obedient must be slaves." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: pani Katarzyna add a quote by Wole Soyinka
item.description: "The greatest threat to freedom is the absence of criticism." -- Wole Soyinka

item.title: pani Katarzyna add a quote by Javier Marias
item.description: "One of the best possible perspectives from which to tell a story is that of a ghost, someone who is dead but can still witness." -- Javier Marias
